channel.title: Homes on Jessica Kasza
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Jessica Kasza

item.description: About me I’m a biostatistician in the Department of Epidemiology and Preventive Medicine at Monash University, in Melbourne, Australia, and I’m part of ViCBiostat: the Victorian Centre for Biostatistics, an NHMRC-funded Centre for Research Excellence. I’m currently the President of the Victorian Branch of the Statistical Society of Australia. We hold seminars every month: see our meetup page for details of upcoming events. I was on the Local organising and Scientific Programme committees of the 2018 Joint International Society for Clinical Biostatistics and Australian Statistical Conference, which took place in Melbourne from the 26-30 of August 2018.

item.title: Methods Publications
item.description: J Kasza, KR Polkinghorne, R Wolfe, SP McDonald, MR Marshall. Comparing dialysis centre mortality outcomes across Australia and New Zealand: identifying unusually performing centres 2008â€“2013. BMC Health Services Research. Accepted December 2018. Open access paper J Kasza, A Forbes. Inference for the treatment effect in multiple-period cluster randomised trials when random effect correlation structure is misspecified. Statistical Methods in Medical Research. Accepted September 2018. Shiny app Click here for a poster summarising this paper, runner-up for best poster pitch at ISCB ASC 2018.

Longitudinal association between foot and ankle symptoms and worsening of symptomatic radiographic knee osteoarthritis: data from the osteoarthritis initiative. Osteoarthritis and Cartilage, (2017) 25(9):1407-1413. DR McIlroy, D Murphy, J Kasza, D Bhatia, L Wutzlhofer, S Marasco. Effects of restricting perioperative use of intravenous chloride on kidney injury in patients undergoing cardiac surgery: the LICRA pragmatic controlled trial.

item.title: Selected presentations
item.description: Society for Clinical Trials, Portland USA, May 2018. Misspecifying within-cluster correlation structure in stepped wedge trials. Society for Clinical Trials & 4th International Clinical Trials Methodology Conference, Liverpool UK, May 2017. Information content of cluster-periods in stepped wedge trials. Australian Statistics Conference, Canberra, December 2016. Causal diagrams, expert opinion and structure learning: vetting the expert. 37th Annual Conference of the International Society for Clinical Biostatistics, Birmingham UK, August 2016.
